intro: Androsace zambalensis, commonly known as the Zambales sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
